parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to official electoral campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to Manolache Vasile, a senatorial candidate.  While it doesn't explicitly mention his party affiliation, the page name "Manolache Vasile - Senator" and hashtags like "#ManolacheVasileSenator" clearly identify him. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags further amplifies its public reach. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post strongly encourages voters to participate in the parliamentary elections. Phrases like "alegerile parlamentare sunt chiar mai importante", "votul tău pentru Parlament contează enorm", and "vino la urne și fii parte din schimbare" explicitly aim to influence voter turnout and implicitly support Manolache Vasile's candidacy. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c". The objective is clearly to increase votes for Manolache Vasile.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic content. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific candidate and encourages voting for him.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not a personal opinion; it's a promotional message advocating for a specific candidate in the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>490813700029217</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, promotes Manolache Vasile's candidacy for the Senate.  While it doesn't explicitly call for votes, the strong encouragement to participate in the parliamentary elections, coupled with the clear identification of Manolache Vasile and the use of promotional hashtags, constitutes electoral propaganda. The post's objective is to influence voters to participate in the elections, thereby indirectly benefiting Manolache Vasile's campaign. The timing of the post, after the official campaign period, is a crucial factor.  The post's reach (100K-500K) and the spend (under RON 100) further indicate an attempt to influence the election.  The absence of a CMF number, while not definitive, raises further concerns.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Manolache Vasile</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 490813700029217) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatura lui Manolache Vasile la Senat,  prin îndemnuri explicite la participarea la alegerile parlamentare și utilizarea de hashtag-uri promoționale (#ManolacheVasileSenator, #SchimbarePentruRomânia, #AlegeriParlamentare, #ImplicareActiva), având un efect electoral pozitiv asupra candidaturii sale.  Reclama, cu o estimare a acoperirii de 100.000-500.000 de persoane și un buget sub 100 RON,  îndeplinește toate criteriile propagandei electorale conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGEA nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006,  în special punctele a) și c),  fiind publicată după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie. Absența unui număr CMF amplifică suspiciunea de încălcare a legislației.  Persoanele responsabile pot fi contactate la contact@momentum.com.ro sau +40767277777.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
